GBReference.GBReference_title: Premature terminal differentiation protects from deregulated lymphocyte activation by ITK-Syk
GBReference.GBReference_remark: GeneRIF: T-cell-specific human ITK-Syk oncogene in mice leads to early polyclonal T cell lymphoproliferation with B cell expansion. It induces terminal T cell differentiation via Blimp-1, eliminating oncogene-expressing cells early in development.

GBReference.GBReference_title: ITK/SYK translocation in angioimmunoblastic T-cell lymphoma
GBReference.GBReference_remark: GeneRIF: Case Report/Letter: ITK/SYK translocation in angioimmunoblastic T-cell lymphoma.

GBReference.GBReference_title: The zinc-binding region of IL-2 inducible T cell kinase (Itk) is required for interaction with Galpha13 and activation of serum response factor
GBReference.GBReference_remark: GeneRIF: a new pathway regulated by Itk in cells, and suggest cross talk between Itk and G-protein signaling downstream of the TcR.

GBReference.GBReference_title: Signaling of the ITK (interleukin 2-inducible T cell kinase)-SYK (spleen tyrosine kinase) fusion kinase is dependent on adapter SLP-76 and on the adapter function of the kinases SYK and ZAP70
GBReference.GBReference_remark: GeneRIF: Data indicate that the intracellular signaling of ITK-SYK requires both SLP-76 and the adapter function of SYK/ZAP-70 kinases.

GBReference.GBReference_title: Interleukin 2-inducible T cell kinase (ITK) facilitates efficient egress of HIV-1 by coordinating Gag distribution and actin organization
GBReference.GBReference_remark: GeneRIF: ITK and Gag colocalized at the plasma membrane and were concentrated at sites of F-actin accumulation and membrane lipid rafts in HIV-1 infected T cells

GBReference.GBReference_title: Proteomics analysis of protein kinases by target class-selective prefractionation and tandem mass spectrometry
Robust phosphoproteomic profiling of tyrosine phosphorylation sites from human T cells using immobilized metal affinity chromatography and tandem mass spectrometry
Identification of phosphorylation sites within the SH3 domains of Tec family tyrosine kinases
Lck phosphorylates the activation loop tyrosine of the Itk kinase domain and activates Itk kinase activity
Activation of BTK by a phosphorylation mechanism initiated by SRC family kinases
Activation of Tsk and Btk tyrosine kinases by G protein beta gamma subunits
Mapping of the gene for the tyrosine kinase Itk to a region of conserved synteny between mouse chromosome 11 and human chromosome 5q
Identification, cloning, and characterization of a novel human T-cell-specific tyrosine kinase located at the hematopoietin complex on chromosome 5q
A novel human tyrosine kinase gene inducible in T cells by interleukin 2

GBSeq.GBSeq_comment: REVIEWED REFSEQ: This record has been curated by NCBI staff. The reference sequence was derived from D13720.1.; This sequence is a reference standard in the RefSeqGene project.; On Sep 21, 2001 this sequence version replaced gi:7949058.; ~Summary: This gene encodes an intracellular tyrosine kinase expressed in T-cells. The protein contains both SH2 and SH3 domains which are often found in intracellular kinases. It is thought to play a role in T-cell proliferation and differentiation. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008]; ~Publication Note: This RefSeq record includes a subset of the publications that are available for this gene. Please see the Gene record to access additional publications.; ##Evidence-Data-START## Transcript exon combination D13720.1, BC109077.2 [ECO:0000332] RNAseq introns single sample supports all introns SAMEA1965299, SAMEA1966682 [ECO:0000348] ##Evidence-Data-END##

GBReference.GBReference_title: Itk-mediated integration of T cell receptor and cytokine signaling regulates the balance between Th17 and regulatory T cells
GBReference.GBReference_remark: GeneRIF: Itk-mediated integration of T cell receptor and cytokine signaling regulates the balance between Th17 and regulatory T cells.

GBReference.GBReference_title: CD28 and ITK signals regulate autoreactive T cell trafficking
GBReference.GBReference_remark: GeneRIF: ITK specifically licenses autoreactive T cells to enter tissues to mount destructive immune responses.

GBReference.GBReference_title: Activation loop dynamics determine the different catalytic efficiencies of B cell- and T cell-specific tec kinases
GBReference.GBReference_remark: GeneRIF: Data show that substitution of 6 of the 619 amino acid residues of Itk (interleukin-2-inducible T cell kinase) with the corresponding residues of Btk (Bruton's tyrosine kinase), and vice versa, completely switched the activities of Itk and Btk.; Publication Status: Online-Only

GBReference.GBReference_title: Cellular and molecular requirements for the selection of in vitro-generated CD8 T cells reveal a role for Notch
The lymphoid lineage-specific actin-uncapping protein Rltpr is essential for costimulation via CD28 and the development of regulatory T cells
CD28 is associated with and induces the immediate tyrosine phosphorylation and activation of the Tec family kinase ITK/EMT in the human Jurkat leukemic T-cell line
The pleckstrin homology domain of Bruton tyrosine kinase interacts with protein kinase C
Mapping of the gene for the tyrosine kinase Itk to a region of conserved synteny between mouse chromosome 11 and human chromosome 5q
itk, a T-cell-specific tyrosine kinase gene inducible by interleukin 2
The ltk receptor tyrosine kinase is expressed in pre-B lymphocytes and cerebral neurons and uses a non-AUG translational initiator
